meaningMnemonic: The kanji and the word are almost exactly the same. That means they share meanings as well.
readingMnemonic:
Since this word consists of a kanji with hiragana attached, you can bet that it will use the kun'yomi reading. You didn't learn that reading with this kanji, so here's a mnemonic to help you: 

What did you do <vocabulary>beforehand</vocabulary>? You had <reading>a raw cas</reading>ual (あらかじ) encounter with <reading>a raw Cage</reading>, Nic Cage. You probably should have planned something better <vocabulary>ahead of time</vocabulary>.
